Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: chriss7930
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better - hidden on a small side street a few minutes’ walk from Palazzo Navarro / The Pantheon. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and fantastic ice creams at Gelateria del Teatro. The hotel itself is small, with friendly staff. Having said that, our room was a really good size and had a cool decor. The only minor irritation being that it was relatively dark. We had breakfast in the room each morning, which again is not the most extravagant, but was perfect for our needs. And the coffee was brilliant! I would thoroughly recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for somewhere to stay that is in a great location, offers value for money and is a bit more than your average chain hotel. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Chic”
Reviews.Author: Short88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the height of tourist season in Rome. The price was reasonable considering this and the location was well worth the money. We were in walking distance of all the major sites. Our room was clean, spacious, and modern (AC included). Moreover we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast service every morning in our private ground floor courtyard. The cappuccinos were excellent. The staff was also very friendly and helped us with service to the airport, sightseeing, etc. We would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem, great value, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah W
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at this hotel. The location was perfect, 10 min walk from St Peter's and in amongst really pretty cobbled streets. Lots of great, reasonable restaurants in walking distance. Hotel ticked all the boxes for us, clean, reasonable, nice room. You order breakfast the night before from a tick list which included the most fantastic croissants and it was delivered to our room at our chosen time so breakfast in bed every day, including fabulous coffee. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good room and perfect price”
Reviews.Author: Larena_11
Reviews.Content: Very quiet location near the Piazza Navona. Many of this city's interesting sites are in walking distance. There are plenty of restaurents in the neighborhood to go for a meal. The room we had was clean and the beds very good. We really enjoyed our stay and can recommend this hotel without any reservations. Excellent value for money. Next time we visit Rome we will book Relais Palazzo Taverna again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting the city”
Reviews.Author: Pink_gabi
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent position, less than five minutes to Navona Square. All the attractions can be visited by foot, we only used public transportation to get from the airport to the city and from the city to the airport. It is placed on a very romantic street called Via dei Coronari in an old building but the interior is very modern. They have also a very good map for discovering the city, with all the streets. We had a room at the second floor, big, clean and very warm and not dark, maybe those from the first floor are more darker. They have WiFi internet free of charge and fast enough. Breakfast is served in the room every morning, you receive every day a paper where you can note what do you want to eat for breakfast next day (you can choose from milk, yoghurt, cereals, croissants, brad with butter and honey or jam, boiled eggs, coffee, tea, cappuccino, hot chocolate). You can choose whatever you want and the hour when do you want to receive the meal, after eight o'clock. I really enjoyed staying in this hotel and I'm very pleased that I've chosen it. I can't find anything to dislike at this hotel and I really recommend it for all those who want to visit Rome and want to be "in the center of the action".

Reviews.Title: “Great location but”
Reviews.Author: Natalieb423
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location with many highlights of Rome within easy walking distance. Rooms are clean and, as we were two women traveling alone, it is safe. We found several good restaurants very nearby. Staff was for the most part friendly and helpful. My only real complaint was the wifi as it worked marginally at best.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kokochan420
Reviews.Content: The area was great, walking distance to most places, and many great restaurants around. The room was clean but very very dark. We had to have the lights on at any time of the day. They also do breakfast in your room, where they bring you some bread and coffee, which was ok. The bathroom was old and small. Not a bad place to stay, but maybe there are nicer places?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: larrybard
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the location -- everything from its site just off of charming Via dei Coronari, to its proximity to Piazza Novona, as well as many points of interest within easy walking distance (Pantheon, etc.) -- is close to ideal for most visitors to Rome. And the rates can make this an exceptional value. I stayed from Nov. 1-6. But note: I was given what apparently was an extremely low rate (by a wonderful, extremely helpful day clerk, whose name I think was something like Giorgio) when I walked in off the street seeking a room for 5 nights. But when I inquired of a different clerk who happened to be staffing the desk another day, about the rate for a room for my wife, who would be looking for a room just as I would be departing, I was initially quoted a much higher rate -- 180 euro for the first night, and 150 for subsequent nights -- than the one I was paying. Later, when Giorgio returned, he agreed to give my wife the same very low rate as I had. So although tte rates presumably vary according to the time of the year and how booked they are, they also apparently vary (at least when you're talking to them in person) accordng to who you deal with, and it may be advisable to try and negotiate a bit. I was in room 301, and had no problems with noise (but maybe that's partially attributable to being generally insensitive to modest street noise). During the day -- but not night -- there are church bells which sound regularly, but I found those to be charming, rather than a shortcoming. Giorgio?

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: theTravellersMandM
Reviews.Content: The room was clean with a nice and comfortable standard interior. The hotel has truly one of the best central yet very quiet locations in Rome. Absolutely recommendable, very good price/ quality ratio. Plus: very friendly staff. Thanks Michael for the nice chats, and Daniel for the helpful advices. (Period of stay: 6 days in August 2011) (Room: 2nd floor in guesthouse)

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: DesignDiva
Reviews.Content: Very small and dark room, but clean and adequate. Considering the location (which was great) and the reasonable price by Rome standards, you can't expect perfection. Breakfast was decent, and served in the room. However, it would have been nice if there was somewhere proper to sit and eat as it was rather awkward to eat sitting at the foot of the bed. Noise carried a fair bit between the rooms and the street noise was quite loud at times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: aarya_ss
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here 6 nights, at a total price of EUR 1020/- (they have marginally higher rates on weekends). We were very pleased with our stay. Much has already been said about the Hotel’s Location. Via dei Gabrielli is actually a very tiny, inclined street, just off Via dei Coronari. The Hotel is 10-15 steps up on Via Gabrielli. You know you’ve reached when you reach the Square with the San Salvatore Lauro Church, the Hotel is a very, very little bit to the right, with your back to the Church Square. The Hotel is about 3 – 4 minutes walking from Piazza Navona (take the third small lane to the right, after making a right on Coronari), 5 minutes from Castel Sant Angelo (in the other direction), about 10 minutes from the Pantheon (via P. Navona) , maybe 15 minutes from Campo di Fiori, so its ideally located. However, what is rarely mentioned is that it is on one of the most picturesque streets in Rome... we saw hordes of tour groups visiting Via Coronari just to photograph it. Coronari, I’m told, used to be one of the roads pilgrims traversed to visit St. Peters, therefore the name Coronari, which means ‘rosary’, since the street was lined with Rosary sellers. The street is now lined with some beautiful Antique Stores, some quirky Home-Decor Shops, Jewellery Stores, several Restaurants & the usual Tabacchi. The Gelataria Teatro, very popular, is just next door. There is a small Carrefour Express on Coronari, incase you need to buy essentials. There is also a Taxi Stand & a Tourist Information Office at the end of the lane, if you make a right on leaving the Hotel. An extremely charming, picture-postcard street. We were initially assigned Room 102, one of two rooms on the same level as the Reception, except right in the back of the property. The Room was fairly small, dinghy, dimly lit, with the tiniest bathroom ever. It did, however, have its own semi private courtyard area, with a small breakfast table. This review would have perhaps read differently if we had continued here. Fortunately, since the AC refused to function, we were shifted (without fuss) to Room 201, on the first floor (approximately 10 steps up), just across from the Kitchen. We heard practically no noise from the Kitchen area though. Now this room, we were happy with. Spacious, with lots of natural light, two small Balconies, Wooden Floors, largish, well lit Bathroom w/tub (and large, clean towels), big Bed, large Desk area (+ 2 Chairs), small Wardrobe... all very nice. As mentioned in previous reviews, the Room offers a Mini Bar (hidden in the cupboard), a Coffee Maker and a wall mounted Television (with all of 2 English Channels, though). It also has the most fabulously effective, sound proofed Windows, which were essential to shut out the street noise & church bells. The Wi Fi worked well. It is easy enough to create more light in the room by simply turning the heads of the wall lamps, which is what we did. This is a small Design Hotel, so all rooms were different, very aesthetically decorated; ours was brown & blue, which looks better than it sounds! All Public Spaces were also well done, with small paintings, mirrors & book shelves lining the corridors and staircases. The Staff was fabulous down to the Asian gentleman who cleaned our Room. What lovely people! Courteous, efficient, informative... just lovely. A special shout out to both Peter & Daniel for the help provided when my boyfriend contracted a fever, we will remember you fondly. Do remember to take a Map from the Hotel, its bang on! The Breakfast was also good, if limited, but Breakfast in Bed is always great! Always punctual, served exactly as ordered, the Breakfast List included the following items (ad verbatim), Coffee, Milk, Hot Chocolate, Tea, Cappuccino, Fruit Juice, Boiled Eggs, Yogurt, Cereal, Bread – Butter – Jam, Honey – Toasted Bread & Croissants. My only suggestion to the Hotel would be to perhaps pay slightly more attention to the cleaning. Both rooms that we occupied were quite grimy in the corners, the bottom of curtains were dirty, the bathroom had some deeply seated grime, there was a lot of dust & the bed linen was definitely not as clean as it should be. Maybe a really thorough cleaning after every check out would go a long way. But this would by my only complaint. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You got to compromise for a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Laylola
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located right in the city center. However, it's better to take a taxi to get there from the station - it'll save your time searching through tiny streets with heavy luggage. The room was ok (we stayed in the one on the icon photo), a bit dusty but overall nice. The breakfast is served into the room - don't forget to order it each evening for the next day. Don't go there if you can't tolerate noise in the night - loud Roman streets are well heard from the hotel windows. And you can always hear all the noises behind the entrance door. We did not enjoy the stuff. They talked politely but seemed crafty. And we got 400 euro stolen from our card the night we paid with it for our stay at the hotel. I'm not blaming anyone until the bank completes the investigation, but there might be some connection...

Reviews.Title: “Wow...perfectly, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: stonesinevergreen
Reviews.Content: Relais Palazzo Taverna arranged our transportation from the airport the morning of our arrival in Rome. What a great service - our family of TEN, plus luggage, in two cars. Seamless, hassel free arrival in the most fantastic location very near the Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Castel St. Angel, lovely shops, and best gelato in Rome one minute from hotel. The hotel looked like it was previously part of private home...a palace. We were a group of 5 teens and 5 adults - all loved the 5 uniquely beautiful, very clean, comfortable rooms we occupied. Breakfast was served in our rooms each morning, so we could get touring bright and early, if we chose to. The very helpful front desk staff, reccommended what turned out to be our favorite restaurant in Italy...Osteria de Memmo. The ten of us felt so lucky having found this best kept secret of a hotel online - 100% agreement: We would choose to stay at Hotel Relais Palazzo Taverna upon our return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisachung15
Reviews.Content: I am quite particular about where I sleep but this hotel has definitely not disappoint me. In fact, it has given us a very pleasant experience. We were there for our honeymoon. Highly recommend this hotel. 1. Superb location. Right in between the Vatican and Piazza Navona. 10 minutes walk to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the rest of the tourist spots. Absolutely love the small lane ways with cobbled roads. Surrounded by lovely cafes and antique shops. Walking back to the hotel is such a pleasant and soothing journey. Very convenient. 2. Staff is friendly and always helpful. They help to carry up our luggages to our room, book us a taxi, recommend great restaurants and provide clear directions. 3. Room is clean and tidy. 4. In room breakfast is served. Love this idea - It is perfect for honeymooners - Breakfast in bed! Quality and varieties are sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: tarryn222
Reviews.Content: The location is really awesome. Its round the corner from the pantheon, piazza navorna, and a 10 min walk to st peters. The rooms is airy with high ceilings, light and breezy white curtains, comfy bed. The bathroom is small but clean and good. There is no view but it is on a quiet cul de sac with a pretty building opposite. There is no breakfast room so breakfast is served in your room which is actually quite nice. Aircon is also great. Service at reception als very helpful. Loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it....”
Reviews.Author: Vermontraveler31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in July 2011 after reviewing many comments on trip advisor about many many hotels. This hotel was in our price range and was very reasonable by Rome standards. I really wanted to love the place and it did have many good qualities but there were just enough things that I didn't love to make me not want to go back. As others have mentioned, the taxi driver did have trouble finding it even with a map I provided but she did and all ended well. The hotel room was ready within 45 minutes of us arriving which was pretty incredible. We all know how important having a bed is after spending the night in flight. It is gracious of them to offer the rooms early. Check in was efficient but it is not friendly. There is no 'let us help you with your plans' or 'let us know if you need anything' but they were not rude either. Our room was #202 and it was very large with a king sized bed which is almost unheard of in small hotels in Europe. It was a dark room with hardwood floors and a small, semi-modern bathroom. There was a loft area as well which we didn't use except to store our suitcases. We wanted to nap right away and absolutely could not. The walls are paper thin and we could hear every room being vacuumed, every dish being put away from breakfast and every cough and sneeze from any other room. I was so disappointed- to be let into our room early but then be unable to sleep. And I'm not just talking a little noise, it was LOUD. We tried our best and mentioned it to the front desk and he wouldn't hear of a room change. (some desk staff, especially the earlier morning person, were kinder.) We had a very nice breakfast brought to our room the next morning by the timely stone faced chef/cleaner. Not friendly but was accurate with the food order and we enjoyed the breakfast. Our room was made up and cleaned each day although we did not notice it being over the top clean as others have noted. It did not smell of cleaning products but did appear to be clean overall. The sleep at night was fine but again, walls so paper thin that you could hear all of the breakfasts being prepared, people coughing, opening and shutting their doors- kind of like a dorm room. I wonder if staying on the 3rd floor would have given us a different experience. So, although our stay was fine, we probably would not choose this hotel again. The pros are having the room ready so early, the king sized bed, large room and breakfast. The cons are the noise level within the hotel, and some staff being unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ali-May-99
Reviews.Content: I just had 6 nights here, as a solo female traveller. The rooms are huge and vey nicely decorated, but very dark. Bathrooms are modern and clean, though rather small as you would expect for a central city hotel. Again, room itself was massive which is such a nice change. Lighting is rather dim though. My room had 1 window opening to a space between the buildings, but let vey little light in. Lighting is modern buy doesn't give much light. So airy room, decorated wig grey silk walls and dark bed clothes, wig dark timber floors and dim lighting. Breakfast is served in you room, which is quite nice. Good breakfast with a few different options. Wifi worked well in the room most times, just a little patchy now and then. Service is vey polite but not the warm, friendly personal service I've had in other small hotels. Still, nothing to complain about, I just like a little more interaction when travelling alone. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Location is brilliant - little pedestrian street 5 mins walk through a beautiful neighborhood to piazza Navona, and 2 mins to Ponte Sant'Angelo. The little pedestrian streets are filled with trendy restaurants and shops. Delightful to walk around at night. Vey safe and just lovely. A taxi can get you within 50 meters / yards from the front door. Busses ate close by but not the metro. Overall, an indulgent stay in the perfect neighbourhood. Would certainly recommend the hotel, and this area in general.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: ld6506
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 min walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Navonna, 10 mins to the Vatican, 15-20 mins to the Spanish Steps and the Fountain of Trevi. Now the hotel...the rooms are great - very modern with modern updated bathrooms. The rooms had hardwood floors and were a fairly good size for Rome. The bed was comfortable and the room overall was very clean. Breakfast orders are placed the night before and breakfast is delivered on time to your room every morning. The breakfast list contains about 15 or 20 items and you can choose as many as you like. The rooms were very quiet and the hotel is on a tiny street with almost no vehicular traffic. One drawback to the hotel for anyone who has trouble with stairs. There is no elevator arenthe rooms are located on the second floor and there are quite a bit of steps. That said, the hotel staff took our luggage from the lobby to the room for us, so all we needed to do was get ourselves there.

Reviews.Title: “Rave review!!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jasmi8
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this place. We stumbled upon it desperately when the original B&B we booked was not as advertised. We looked through our Lonely Planet guide book for recommendations and called Relais Palazzo Taverna late on a Tuesday night hoping they had availability the next day. Fortunately they did and told us we could come leave our bags with them in the morning since check in wasn't until later in the day. We arrived at about 8 am and not only did the owner, Daniel, check us in early and show us our room right then, he also gave us a 20 euro discount than what had been quoted on the phone the night before! If that's not enough, they served us breakfast within 15 minutes of getting settled in our room! The place was immaculate, clean, and designed beautifully. We loved the location, it was safe, and within walking distance to everything. Daniel was so helpful the entire time, giving us information and recommendations of places to go. We wanted to stay a third night but unfortunately they were already full since it was Friday night, but Daniel called and found us another hotel at the same price that was fine. I highly recommend this place!!! Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and good location”
Reviews.Author: feline2ca
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, although a little dark. But it was clean, the bathroom was nice and breakfast (included in price) was delivered on time every morning. The staff was helpful with any questions, although don't expect too much advice on booking tours, etc. We had an air conditioner in the bedroom, which was nice. Please be aware that this is not a standard hotel with a main lobby. The door to our room was open to the street, and there was no hallways or secure lobby. It was a 10 min walk to the Vatican, less to Castle Saint Angelo and to Plazza Navona. Lots of little restaurants, stores, gelato nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Trav11er
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, great location as it is far enough away from main tourist attractions that the streets have a decent amount of local flavor and not crowded with tourists. Great gelato shop nearby. Room we had was a bit dark with only 3 lamps and hard beds but good size and very quiet. staff were efficient and nice enough but they aren't there to have extensive conversations with you - if your main goal is a chatty staff, this isn't your place but worked great for us. Several great restaurants nearby as well. great neighborhood for meandering. i'd stay here again. for sure. wifi included worked really well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet spot and close to Piazza Navona”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Russman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and was great - very close to piazza navona and the castle - yet in a low traffic (taxis only!) laneway that was very quiet. About 3 minute walk from Navona Staff are very friendly and helpful and reception is open 24 hours. Great spot and would recommend. Breakfast is brought to your room and extensive selection and delicious. Very good value for a hotel in the heart of an (expensive) and lovely city

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: darandriley
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel tucked away in an excellent location in central rome - and honestly a really good price for the location. Stayed with a group of three in a bedroom plus livingroom/pullout couch split level room that had its own terrace. The staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was excellent - you got to pick from a list each day and it was delivered to your room each morning. The location was one of the best parts of it - we walked to absolutely every attraction - 10min or less to the vatican and trevi fountain, 15-20 min to the colloseum. The area is so quiant and picturesque. Tons of excellent restaurants and gellaterias in the area. The price was also really very good - i looked at tons of hotels in the area and it was at least 50-100 Euro less per night than everytthing around it. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: MFE59
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. In the center of Rome yet on a quiet small street. Easy walking distance to all the attractions. Found the hotel staff very helpful and friendly. We stayed for 6 nights so we met pretty much everyone on staff. Having breakfast in the room was nice --great to have coffee when you wake up. Don't expect anything too fancy for breakfast. Room was small, as one might expect in Rome. But it was a great room. It had everything we needed. Nicely decorated. Comfy bed. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel. Thanks to the staff for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff acted as if closest relative had just died, and we caused said death.”
Reviews.Author: Oscaramarone
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome for the last night of our month-long holiday in Italy. We found this hotel in Australia's lonely planet guide and thought we'd treat ourselves on our last night - at €180/night, it was almost double what we paid at the first place we stayed in Rome nearly 4 weeks before (A Peace of Rome, cnr via Fabio Massimo & via Germanico). We arrived at the hotel, to a reception only mildly warmer than a 9/11 victim may greet Osama Bin Laden, were he still with us. No 'buongiorno', no 'ciao,' no 'benevenuti' - nothing. A perfunctory 'Passports!' was the first and final communication from the front desk. The room was fine, although toilet seat had obvious crack in it and room signs of wear and tear and no advice or assistance given in relation to local sights, restaurants or even how to work the tv (and no instructions in room). In fact, when my partner went down to reception to ask for assistance with the tv, the staff member was clearly put out at having his football viewing interrupted and told her angrily 'it should work' ... 'just use the big remote' etc etc and only eventually begrudgingly came up to show us how to get a channel. Every time we left the hotel and every time we returned, we received the same surly attitude, from 2 different staff members and it left a very bad taste in our mouths , considering we had spent 29 fantastic nights in Italy with amazingly friendly people and hardly a bad experience. Great location for sure, but completely unnecessary attitude and for half the price, and none of the attitude, stay at A Peace of Rome. We arrived at the hotel to a reception slightly warmer 9/11 However, the reception we received on arrival at Relais Palazzo Taverna was chillier than that exto how Obama

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel on a quiet street in the heart of the historic center”
Reviews.Author: arthurlord
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel if you want to be in the heart of Rome's historic center, but don't want to be on a loud street. Tucked away among winding side streets, it might take your taxi driver a few minutes to find it, but it's pretty easy to find once you go the first time. The rooms aren't large, but very well maintained. The staff is extremely helpful and accomodating. Breakfast in bed every morning is a great way to start life in the eternal city!!!

Reviews.Title: “In a quiet, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: ayeirini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais Palazzo Taverna for 7 nights in mid March for our honeymoon. It was in a lovely neighborhood, absolutely quiet in the evening. We liked the room interior, very cozy but nice and clean. Our room was next to the kitchen - so avoid room 202 if you want a quiet morning, although I am not sure with the thin walls and door how quite it would be in other rooms either. Breakfast was delivered to our room, which was a nice touch - but we never exactly got around which is what... we kept ordering same thing but we got different bread every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Relais in Beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: srayburn
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending 5 nights in a simple double room. Our room was spotless and had everything we needed, including a small refrigerator and a safe. The breakfast served each morning was lovely and as much as we needed, a very simple Italian breakfast with cappuccino, pastries, juice, etc. and having it delivered to the room was very convenient as I didn't have to deal with getting my young son up and dressed to go down for breakfast. We were on the 2nd floor, no lift, but the few steps were no problem. The location was so fantastic, I was thrilled. We have visited Rome several times, but this location was spot on. The location was remarkable not only for its proximity to major tourist sites, but because the immediate neighborhood is simply beautiful with the small and winding streets leading to the Piazza Navona with lovely shops, bars, pizzarias and restaurants. We could not have been happier with our choice and will stay again in a heartbeat if we are not renting an apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Everything on your doorstop, perfect after a tiring day”
Reviews.Author: GillNLondon
Reviews.Content: Our room (102) was a really good size with lovely courtyard too and having breakfast delivered each morning was great. The Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona are walking distance and slightly longer is the Coloseum, Palatine, Piazza Venezia. The hotel is on a quiet side street but there are loads of authentic Italian restaurants and gelateria not to mention funky bars which were spilling onto the streets during the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, off a quiet, quaint pedestrian street”
Reviews.Author: TrueToTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, had modern stylish upgrades and friendly staff, who were helpful in offering recommendations on organizing the many attractions to see in Rome. This hotel offered breakfast included in the rate that was delivered to your room each morning, a great touch! The room was cleaned each day and it was in a quiet location. We were able to walk to all the attractions we wanted to see. The hotel even arranged for transportation to the airport at a reasonable rate, as Rome was our last stop on our trip. All in all a great hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights in August. It us very comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location is fantastic. Would definitely stay again if visiting Rone.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: LongKarl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location for walkers. We walked everywhere except to the Borghese Gallery and we walked back from there. The hotel is in an old building. (Is there any other kind in Rome?) Our room (304) was a clean, attractive room, big enough for 2 comfortable single beds in one corner with about 8’ to each of the other two walls. It had about a 15’ ceiling with French doors out onto an alley. Quiet: The hotel is on a side alley off a small square that is some distance from busy streets. It was furnished in a spare modern way and decorated in a contemporary style. There was one chair. A large enough bathroom, but if you drop the soap in the shower, be prepared to squat because there isn’t enough room to bend over. Small complaint: a cheap, plastic toilet seat that slides, and no stopper for the sink. The room was cleaned while we were gone. A good breakfast was ordered the night before and delivered to the room. The professional staff consists of one friendly, accommodating person behind a counter on the ground floor. The desk is staffed 24 hours per day. Using their staff to make reservations is iffy. We asked for reservations for the Borghese Gallery before we arrived and they had not been made; however, they were made when we arrived and we got our second choice of times on the following day. Apparently they have no system of transferring such requests to the next person on duty when they are having a day or two off. The taxi from the airport was overpriced because he was very late—management is working on that. Everyone was helpful. Daniel was particularly good with directions to a travel agency and with other items of information. It’s expensive for what you get, but Rome is an expensive city. Compare prices.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem, centrally located in the heart of Rome's Centro Storico, tucked away in a quiet alley. It is within walking distance to The Pantheon, Piazza Navona and The Vatican. The staff was courteous and helpful; they offered to have a car pick us up from the airport and assisted in figuring out transportation to our next destination, Siena. The room we stayed in was quite large and clean; two level, contemporary decorated with a comfortable bed and a second loft like level, where one could just lounge. AC worked great, free internet connection was available although we didn't use it and the small flat screen TV offered a couple of BBC world channels in English. The bathroom was impeccably clean and spacious. Breakfast is served in the room at a time of your choosing and it includes pastries, hard boiled eggs and the most delicious cappuccino! There is no elevator, so expect to climb some stairs, but the staff will help with the luggage. Relais Palazzo Taverna is a great value and most definitely a place we'll come back to when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, small boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PollyP2010
Reviews.Content: Relais Palazzo Taverna hotel is in a really pretty, quiet corner of Rome. It is actually quite central, and very close to both Piazza Navona and the Vatican City, so it is surprising how quiet it is there. I am a very light sleeper, and slept really well in this hotel. I had a single room, which was small but very clean, and fine for my purposes. The hotel is small so there are only a few other guests. This is by no means a five-star, luxury experience. But if you are looking for something that is clean, comfortable, nicely furnished and in an excellent location, this hotel is perfect. It is within easy walking distance of all the major attractions in Rome, and my favourite gelato place (Gelateria del Teatro - don't miss!) is literally a few steps away. There is also a mini mart diagonally opposite, which was very convenient. The street the hotel is on** is lined with beautiful antique stores, and there are several nice restaurants very nearby as well. (**I am referring to Via dei Coronari, although the hotel is officially on Via dei Gabrielli. Gabrielli is actually more like a courtyard that comes off Coronari, and doesn't appear on all maps of Rome. Coronari, however, is a long street which should appear on your map, and if you walk down Coronari, you will see the hotel easily in its little courtyard a few steps off Coronari.) My room had a small refrigerator and tea / coffee making facilities. The bathroom was impeccably clean and had all the usual bathroom goodies, which were replenished daily. When I came back to the hotel each day, it was clear that it had been cleaned thoroughly, not just made up. The hard wood floors were mopped every day, and every surface in both the bedroom and the bathroom were always sparkling clean. It was so nice to come home to a room that smelled so fresh, unlike other hotels I stayed at in Italy! A perfectly adequate breakfast (continental) is served each day in your bedroom, promptly at whatever time you had requested the previous afternoon. For me, the best thing about staying here (apart from the quiet) was the walk home each day. The hotel is in a really lovely area, on a cobbled backstreet (which minimises street noise) with planter boxes, greenery cascading down the walls, and lots of shuttered windows and old doorways. It was such a pleasure to walk around in the surrounding cobbled backstreets and alleys, which lead you to Piazza Navona in a couple of minutes. I would definitely stay here again, and would happily recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Beej62
Reviews.Content: My first impression was disappointment. The picture of the hotel on the website is actually the view FROM the hotel into the small piazza below. The hotel itself is actually tucked up a tiny, narrow, dark alley across from the piazza. Once I recovered from the feeling of being deceived, things improved. Our room was #101, not the best in the place, tucked behind the reception area and below ground level. The window was high on the wall and let in very little light and the low ceiling added to the atmosphere of medieval Rome, which is exactly when this little gem was built! All that being said, we were greeted warmly and the offer was made to move our room the following day. One glance at the twisting, marble stairway convinced me that the1st floor was the place for me! Let me just say, the room lent itself to comfy napping (good air conditioning). Once settled and getting our bearings, it was obvious we were in the very best location in all of Rome. We could walk to all the attractions, run by the room to nap or freshen up, and then be off again. As others have said, a lovely breakfast was delivered to the room each morning that we did eat while sitting on the bed. I have nothing else to compare to regarding cost-at 180 euros a night, it was the most expensive of our trip, but then again it is Rome and it is in a prime location. My bigest complaint was that there was no place to relax outside-no terrace or patio. But the street has plenty of al fresco dining available. I would only ask for thicker towels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RHamilton22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a safe and fun location. Many things to see and do. you will never go hungry with the many great restaurants near by. Piazza Navona is a skip and a step away and what a treat to be so near such a beautiful place. Also dont miss out on the Ponte de St. Angelo. The bridge itself is an amazing sight with the vatican to one side and the Castello st. Angelo right in front, it doesnt get much better than this. At night everything lights up and there are vendors and music. All this is a few blocks from this hotel. The location alone is worth it. We walked everywhere from here, and yes we were tired but Rome is best seen on foot so take many breaks but do walk to your destinations. The hotel itself is clean and the rooms are large. Breakfast is brought to your room but it is very very limited nothing like the other hotels we stayed at but thats not a good reason not to stay here. I wouldn't want to stay in any other area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: jennyersbak
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for at this beautiful boutique hotel - great service, friendly atmosphere and excellent accommodation. Relais Palazzo Taverna is tucked away in a quaint alleyway, right smack in the middle of the historic center of Rome. Everything is in walking distance! Our triple room accommodation was roomy, comfortable with a hint of sophistication (I loved the wallpaper!). The staff was very helpful and delivered a simple, yet delicious, breakfast to our room every morning. This hotel is a great option for those looking to spend a little more, but still want that personal B&B vibe. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A stone's throw from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon.”
Reviews.Author: LilianaMaria
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Taverna's location is superb. Very close to some of the most important sites in Rome (the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Campo di Fiori and others). The hotel itself is very chic and modern, the same with the decor. Very, very clean and quiet. Located on a street away from main street traffic. Breakfast is served in the room between 8 and 10 a.m. (you choose the time) and consists of coffee, toast, hot chocolate, boiled eggs, croissants, toast, cereal, yogurt, jams etc. The room was very clean, nicely decorated and quiet. Big enough for me and my wife. There is no elevator but the staff is very helpful and carried our luggage upstairs. The staff is available 24/7 and are very kind and helpful. Considering how expensive staying in the city's historic center can be, this hotel has great value for it's location and quality. We would definitely stay here again. If you stay here you should try the gelatto at the Gelatteria del Teatro, located in an alley next to the hotel. It's Rome's best.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a wonderful neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Runrabbitrun1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for two nights during June 2010, we arrived at Fiumicino airport on a Sunday afternoon and were greeted by our driver which was pre arranged with the hotel. The drive to the hotel was certainly an experience for us as it was our first time in Rome. Our room was located on the third level and was neat and tidy, if not a little on the small side; this did not particularly bother us though because we spent very little time in the room and only stayed for two nights. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is situated in a quiet area amongst many antique shops and within only a couple of minutes walk to numerous cafes and restaurants. We explored Rome mainly by foot and found the hotel a convenient base to explore the city. The crowds were intense during our time in Rome, so it was nice to have a quiet room to retreat to at the end of our day/night. We were served breakfast in the room each morning (had to sit on the bed to eat it) which was more than adequate, the coffee, pastries, cereal and eggs were more than enough to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Mitsumaru
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. Great location, spacious and clean room with breakfast served directly to your room. All main attractions are within walking distance. Warmly recommended and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great safe location, short walk to many sights!”
Reviews.Author: Hilary013
Reviews.Content: Can't complain about this hotel. It was very clean, the breakfast was nice, and the location was great. It is about a 4 minute walk to the Piazza Navona. We arrived early from the airport (around 11am), knowing that we wouldn't be able to check-in, we just wanted to drop off our luggage. They sped up getting our room ready, so we only had to wait 10 minutes to get in our room. The room was very large and modern, but with a warm feel. Whoever designed this place did a great job. We even had a pretty view out of the window. We only had breakfast the first day because it isn't served until almost 8am and we had to be somewhere early on the next two mornings. The breakfast was nice. You get a card to choose stuff like croissants, cereal, juice, coffee, yogurt, etc. and leave it at reception the night before with the time you want it served in your room. Every night when we came back to our room, it had been cleaned thoroughly. The air-conditioning worked well, the internet was easy (and free) to access with my ITouch, and the flat screen TV had BBC World for a bit of TV in English. For all of the perks of this place in the middle of Rome, it was a total steal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique Hotel with an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Wilbur1226
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Palazzo Taverna in the beginning of June, upon arrival we were greeted by Daniel one of the owners. You immediately feel like you're welcomed into someone's home. The hotel has a very home-like feel, there is no elevator and each of the rooms are uniquely decorated. And Daniel was amazingly helpful in his restaurant recommendations, each recommendation was better than the next and it really helped make our trip as wonderful as it was. We were first placed in the first floor room in the back with a private courtyard but we were offered another room on the 2nd floor which was nicer for us. It had a lot more light and floor to ceiling windows that opened up for a nice afternoon breeze, perfect for a siesta. The hotel is the perfect location, we walked to every main attraction in Rome, including Vatican City, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountian, Villa Medici, Pantheon, the Trastavere area, Roman Forum, Coloseum to name a few. The hotel is within the Piazza Navona and Campo di Fiori area. You can't match the location of this hotel and when visiting Rome again, I would stay at the Relais Palazzo Taverna again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pegscraper
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Located in a quiet cul-de-sac off Via de Coronari (antique central), it's a few minutes walk from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. As a huge bonus to all you gelato fans, Gelateria del Teatro is only one half block away. Arguably the best gelato in all of Italy (says my bulging wasteline). Our room (301) was quiet and comfy. The bathroom lacked storage space (no vanity or shelf), but the shower was very good. The climate control was perfect and the bed was very comfortable; good sleeping. The in room breakfasts were as ordered and of high quality and on time. Free and reliable wi-fi helped enhance our stay. The staff was excellent and very helpful. For the price, this was the best hotel we stayed at in our two weeks in Italy. A great deal!!

Reviews.Title: “HIdden gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CitBree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days in Rome and I chose this place based on the location and Trip Advisor reviews. Hotels for me are a place to rest my head at night. I don't need anything too fancy since I don't spend much time in the room. Therefore, I look for location and price. I was VERY pleased with this place. It was a little hard to find at first (the cab dropped us off at the end of the street), but I'm glad it's hard to find. It's down a nice quiet street that kinda gives you a less touristy taste of rome. But it's just a short walk to Piazza Navona (so short we kept walking past it because I couldn't imagine it was that close). We are very active so we walked everywhere from here: the colloseum, the spanish steps, the Vatican, even back from Termini when we went to get our train ticket. The room was pretty spacious -- more than I expected. There was free wi-fi which was a major bonus. Our window was right above the entrance so when people smoked out there, our room smelled a bit. This was only bad the first time we walked into the room. I was going to complain but figured it didn't bother me too much. We never even had that problem again after that. Every night you fill out the notecard to tell them what you want for breakfast in the morning. They bring it to your room at the desired time. The selection isn't that great but it's something to get you started before you go out. Also, they don't tell you when they start delivering -- we left really early one day so I asked for it at 6:30am and it never came (they don't start until 7 or 8 I think). Again, no big deal. I'm not too bothered by stuff like that when i'm in vacation mode. The staff was nice and helpful but not overly so. If I had questions, they answered them but didn't provide more help. One guy I think was more shy than the others. Overall, I would stay here again no doubt. Location is the top concern for me and this one was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: G134Smith
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Relais Palazzo Taverna with two friends in the last weekend of February 2010. We stayed in one of the suites, sleeping 4 with a private courtyard. The hotel arranged our collection from the airport and we had breakfast delivered to the room each morning on trays. The location was absolutely perfect for us - less than 10 minutes to the pantheon and very close to a number of beautiful bars and restuarants. If I return to Rome I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGolightly
Reviews.Content: spacious room, but would be more comfortable with some more furniture - especially since breakfast is delivered to the room. there is only one chair so the other person has to eat in bed. wooden floorboards look great, but they're not very sound proof - which is ok if you don't have a family (with an active child running around; and the couple arguing loudly) staying in the room above you like we did. no lift, but the person on reception was helpful enough to carry one of our suitcases upstairs for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Dane52
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. The service friendly and helpful. The rooms clean and of a good size, though a bit on the dark side, as the hotel is in a narrow alley (just around the corner from Via dei Coronari). The bathroom sparkling clean, and we loved the shower-head, which was huge and had loads of water coming out! Breakfast was served in the room exactly at the requested time, and it was much better than many other places in Italy. Great coffee! A fridge in the room made it possible to keep extras (like cheese) for breakfast. We could have used a small table and a soft chair, there certainly is room for it! I have difficulties in sleeping away from home as I usually hear every noise, but here I slept like a log. My husband heard the trash being collected in the morning, otherwise it was extremely quiet. We will definitely come again - and definitely recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneA_t
Reviews.Content: A very good location, all the rooms are of different sizes, ranging from very small to large. Rooms are serviced daily, breakfast is very good, delivered to your room. They do however have some problems with the drainage in the showers, this may be just old pipes. So don't be put off by the rising water when you take a shower. I would avoid the ground floor rooms because of the musty water smell. In stating this however, the hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Residenza in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: cami_denya
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel. The location was perfect, about 5 minutes walk to the river which you cross over to see St Peters and going the other way towards Piazza Navona (7 minutes) the Pantheon 15 minutes and 30 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. This walk is very easy as there is so much to see on the way, which you would miss if you caught a taxi. There are so many little alleyways with nice restaurants to choose from and lovely shops too. The hotel is in the Antique district and as you walk towards Piazza Navona it is nice to look in the windows at the wonderful antique furniture they have in the windows. The hotel is decorated with a modern/contemporary feel, everything was very clean and tidy, lovely bathrooms with hot water, and a nice breakfast, which is brought to your room at the time you request. My favourite was the hot chocolate in the morning which was pipping hot . The staff on reception were very helpful. We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: maria99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon in Italy and Rome was our second stop on our trip. In short, it's a fab hotel. It is located in a lovely part of Rome, swanky restaurants nearby and the major sights a short walk away. We were in room 202. The room was a little on the dark side, but it was down a side road so couldn't be helped, however room was fantastically decorated with black and white feature wall and mezzanine level and everything was very clean. The room was next to the kitchen, which did get a little noisy around 8am every morning while they prepared breakfast, but we were always waking up around this time so it really was not a problem. Breakfast was served in your room, so it was great to be woken up with a hot cup of black coffee and croissant first thing! Overall, fantastic value and excellent service any hour of the day - we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: readymade
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights after a cruise. I'd stay again in an instant. You can't get this combination of location, service, and lodging for this price anywhere else. We booked a triple room since that was all they had left when we reserved. It's the one illustrated in the website; it has a big queen bed, then an elevated platform with a twin bed and a tiny day bed that could be used for small children. So it could actually accommodate a family of four. Bathroom was very nice, roomy for a Rome hotel, good water pressure, included bidet. AC worked, breakfast was delivered as promised. Internet was reliable and fast and easy to access. Staff was always helpful and professional. This location is unbeatable. It's off the quiet Via dei Coronari, so it's near to everything, but feels secluded and private. It may prove hard to find, and the street was closed to cars when we were there. Our cab driver from Termini had a hard time figuring out where it was and just dropped us off at the end of Via dei Coronari. But it's worth the effort to get here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: J10CatEye
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights, and our experience was WONDERFUL. It's a little gem tucked away in a quiet, very central corner nestled between the Piazza Navona and the Vatican. The front staff was extremely helpful and spoke very good English. We were upgraded to a two floor loft with a private terrace. The air conditioning could have been cooler, but it was tolerable for a couple days. Breakfast is served in your room, but there's also a very nice coffee shop right around the corner for a quick pastry and espresso!! For the price and location, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Steph74
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through booking.com. Ideal quiet location, minutes walk from Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. Restaurants and bars all in walking distance. Central location for all sites within walking distance. Big room with safe and air conditioning. The bathroom had the luxury of a bath which is wonderful after a days site seeing!!! Helpful and knowledgeable staff, security of a 24 hour reception. We would return and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AdPal80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all I hoped for, offering boutique accommodation with tremendous access to all the major sites in Rome. When we arrived there was an unavoidable issue with our room but the staff was on top of the situation and arranged for us to spend one night in a nearby hotel at the same rate. The next morning we arrived in our room and were impressed at the size and cleanliness. There is an additional bonus of complimentary WiFi. Breakfast is included with the room and is delivered at the time of your choice. The choices are standard continental breakfast items and you may order as little or as much of any one item. The location cannot be beat. The neighborhood is quiet yet you're minutes away from the bustle of the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Campo di Fiori, and the Piazza d'Espagne. Combine this with the proximity to the Forum Romanum and Vatican city and you have an excellent launching pad to soaking in the sights of the eternal city. You'll never go hungry either with the abundant array of cafes and restaurant located nearby as well. The staff is incredibly friendly and fluent in English. Always willing to help and make sure you have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable. I will definitely be staying here again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: NJinthesun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an ideal location. It was a quick walk to the Vatican, Piazza Navona and other major Rome landmarks. The place was romantically set in a narrow alleyway surrounded by antique shops, churches, and our favorite gelato shop. The room was commfortable,beds were great, a room safe was provided and service was praiseworthy. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. We had a choice of breakfast meals which was delivered to our room. The only inconvenience was the scaffolding up outside of the hotel and in our tiny courtyard which was not attractive to look at. We did not encounter noise or safety issues as result, but it did detract from the appearance of the place. The value was excellent given the location, size of the room and season.

Reviews.Title: “Really wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Kellermeyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a gem. The staff was amazing. Georgio at the front desk speaks seven differnet languages fluently. He answered all of my questions, and I had many. The location was perfect in historic Rome. We walked to every major site, and bused to the Forum. There were no shortage of great shops and restaurants. The room was clean and huge. It was quiet. No elevator, however, if that is important to you. We arranged a car to take us to the hotel and back to the airport, which I would recommend for a mere 10 more euros than a taxi. It is tricky to find the first time. The in-room breakfast was great and on time. They even allowed us to check-in early at no additional cost. We loved it here. Seriously, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoise
Reviews.Content: We loved this place...it was a beautiful little hotel with lots of character in a location that cannot be beat. It was within easy walking distance of almost all of Rome's sites. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms clean. This is not a five star hotel, but a very good hotel in the mid to lower price range. I would definitely stay again and would recommend it to others. They serve breakfast in your room at the time you specify and it arrived like clockwork each and every morning. A Hidden Gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Secret treasure in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: peteandnina
Reviews.Content: Once found a great place to stay, tucked away in Centro Storico. Within walking distance of EVERYTHING!! We mean everything!!! (If fit and able.) We walked to every major sight and of course it is on the doorstep of both the Vatican and the magnificent (and free) Pantheon. We took a coach transfer from the Ciampino airport to the Termini train station and then a bus no. 40 (fast and frequent) 4 stops along to the hotel. Here is the only downside it took us ages to find the hotel. ALTHOUGH this maybe a fault that lies with our guide book and map to be fair to the hotel. Don't expect local shop owners, taxi drivers or other locals to know where the hotel is situated, they had no idea, it really is a small gem being only 11 rooms! Once found it is truly a treasure. A great place for a getaway and some time together. The room was stylishly decorated and had everything needed. High standards for a 3star hotel / B&B. Breakfast was as plentiful as you order....we ordered loads. There is no breakfast room so it is served when you want in your own room which is a nice touch. See other reviews for the full brekkie list! They do not lie! :) Would definitely stay again. And who knows we might just arrange that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wendysanti
Reviews.Content: Could not imagine a better location. This boutique hotel is conveniently situated near the Palazzo Navona (2 minutes on foot). Clean, good breakfast, reasonably priced, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mfueyo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Relais Palazzo Taverna recently and loved everything about it. The location is perfect- 5 minute walk to Piazza Navona and Campo Di Fiore, a little further to the Pantheon. Some great restaurants nearby. The hotel staff were all vere nice and accomodating. Breakfast was served in our room every day. It was very clean; really, no complaints at all. One of the best things about it was how quiet it was, which is hard to find in Rome. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us stayed here and we all loved this hotel. The rooms were lovely and the breakfast was great. The staff were helpful with left bags, taxis etc. The only downside was we were given the room behind reception, which is huge, but also gets all the noise day and night from the front desk. If you are a light sleeper request any room but this one. We got a really good deal on this hotel and the location was fantastic. Right near Piazza Navona yet far enough away to be in a quiet st. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MaxOslo
Reviews.Content: We paid 80 €/night, breakfast incl., booked through Venere. This 12-room town house suite hotel in Rome was a wonderful experience. We stayed here for one week, and except for the first night, when we got a spacious appartement next door that smelled of smoke, we were very happy with the hotel and it's surroundings. It is as centrally located in the historical centre of Rome as possible. In addition, it is in a pedestrian area, so it's really quiet. If you take a taxi to the hotel, it will bring you to the entrance, but if you come by bus, you will have to walk about 250 meters with your luggage. From the hotel, we walked to every sight, and there were lots of restaurants nearby. The hotel itself is a charming old townhouse with modern interiors. I'm Scandinavian, so finding IKEA design almost everywhere was a bit boring, but nevertheless the rooms looked nice and the beds were good. Nice, tiled bathrooms, and individually controlled airconditioning. Very serviceminded staff. There were no breakfast room, but in the evening you just filled out a form to order your breakfast, and it was served in your room at the requested time. Nice decent breakfast with choices like bread, croissants,butter, jam and honey,cereals, yoghurt, juice, milk, and various hot drinks. The coffee with warm milk tasted really good. There is no elevator in the property. We consider 80 € a night a bargain in early July. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little maintenance goes a long way”
Reviews.Author: CAhoosier
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this hotel. It has everything that appeals to me, great location, boutique hotel, old building but decorated with a modern aesthetic. On paper it all looked perfect. We booked directly with the hotel and everything went smoothly when we arrived. The room looked exactly like the photos on the website except it really needed a good cleaning. The white walls were beat up and desperately in need of paint, the bottom edge of the white curtains was black with dirt, the sofa was stained and had marks where they had tried to clean it, there was a film of dust on top of the fabric headboard and from the wrinkly condition of the sheets, I'm not confident they had been changed. To top it off, the toilet seat was cracked clean through and the soap dish in the shower was broken off. The room looked like it had been through one too many spring break parties. Would I stay here again? Maybe... if I couldn't find anything else appealing in the price range. The location was excellent. The public spaces are lovely. The room was huge with french doors that opened onto the alley in front.. The staff was helpful and breakfasts were delicious (even if the saucers were chipped). I'm a stickler for details and while this hotel has great potential, our room fell apart in the details.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Friendly, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JPVLondon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and stylishly furnished and decorated. Bathrooms were new and clean. The staff at the hotel were really friendly and nothing was too much trouble. They were happy to change our room after the first night, as the original room was near reception and the area where they prepared breakfast so it was a little noisy for us. The alternative room was great though. Staff also helped us with restaurant reservations and taxis. Breakfast was delivered to the room each morning and although not large (which is the Italian way) was very nice. The location was also good and all of the main sights were within easy walking distance. We also found some great bars and wine shops in the area which was less touristy than other parts of Rome. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bostravelerBoston
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel with all its charm. It is very chic and the owners did a great job of mixing the old (original wood ceiling beams from the 1400's) with the new (fine furnishings and decor). There are 3 floors: there only appeared to be 1 room on the first floor behind the check in desk, (room 101) which seemed like it would be a nightmare, then there about about 5 rooms on the second floor and 6 rooms on the third floor. We stayed on the second floor which was fine. If I went again I would stay on the third floor since my prefence is to always be on the highest floor but with no elevator if you have more than one suitcase it will be a pain to drag up the flights of stairs. Our room was very spacious but the bathroom was teeny tiny, but I guess you should expect that for Europe. It was set back down a small street so it was very quiet which is a REAL PLUS for Rome. The central location is great and the neighborhood was very safe. It is 2 minute walk to Castle St. Angelo and 6 minutes walk to the Vatican. We booked on Hotels.com and paid $137 plus tax which was cheaper than the hotel's website www.relaispalazzotaverna.com advertised. Be sure to visit their website because it really photographs the place in the best light. I did email them with my floor prefence and they emailed me back the next day with a yes to accomadate me. We thought the price was extremely good for the money and you would be hard pressed to find something as nice as in this price range. The only negative I can give is that someone was smoking in the next room in the middle of the night and it waffed into our room and I could smell it. This is not the fault of the hotel but of the inconsiderate European hotel guests in the next room!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: greggcl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room 201 for 4 nights in January 2008, and it was exactly what we expected. A spaceous bedroom with a well appointed bathroom, with shower, bath. bidet and basin with a good selection of towels and a hair dryer. The staff who brought our cases to our room, also prepared our selected breakfast, and also clean our room each day, and even folded my pj's and put them under my pillow! For 120 euro's a night in low season, with a well selection of breakfast, cable tv and wifi, it was well worth it. The hotel faced a lovely piazza, onto the via corianria, and was 2 minutes to the river, 10 minutes to St Peter's and 3 minutes to Piazza Navorna. Come out of the hotel, turn right, right, left and right and you are at the best tratatoria in Rome, Da Franessca. Well recommended. Gregg and Clare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine place to stay, decent service”
Reviews.Author: anewyorker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights in mid-October. For a place that's listed as a budget hotel, the Relais Palazzo Taverna is a great find. Of course budget is a relative term these days what with the dreadful shape of the dollar. My room was basic, but nonetheless well-appointed, well maintained, and clean, as was the bathroom. Breakfast, which was included in the price, was delivered each morning roughly at the time I requested on the delivery card. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful. If the dollar doesn't improve I would definitely stay here again.....and maybe even if it does because the location is perfect. My one criticism is that the wifi signal was too weak to access the web.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay, Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evananders
Reviews.Content: Desiring to switch hotels we walked into the Palazzo Taverna and were pleasantly greeted and accommodated. Were we lucky as this is one of the best kept secrets of Rome. Great quiet neighborhood with small shops, cafes, galleries and no cars yet walking distance to everything in historic center (they give you free bikes if you'd like). Clean modern elegantly simple rooms, large modern baths, high ceilings, peaceful and refreshing decor. Staff was the best I have seen in a hotel, always helpful, smiling. Great breakfast served in room on chic modern china. Next door is historic Palazzo Taverna, private art complex, a few blocks from Tiber. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and now that I am home, I actually miss being there!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nymfe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the most cosy area of town.You can walk to everything. The room was absolutely wonderfull, clean and good space. Decoration beautiful. Staff extremly helpfull and kind. Breakfast in room great and on time. If I am going to Rome again this will be the place to stay - I could not imagine a better place to stay. Regards Fogemann

Reviews.Title: “No room available when we arrived!!!”
Reviews.Author: hellokimmer
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay here (through venere) for our last night in Rome, but was turned away at the door when we arrived. Was offered a room at the same rate way across town near Circus Massimo at another hotel. Relais Palazzo Taverna paid for the taxi to get us to the other hotel, and told us the other hotel would have better rooms and Relais would pay the difference in the room rate. The other hotel was not better in my opinion, and I felt absolutely cheated by the whole experience. Lesson learned - triple check your hotel reservations before you travel especially if you book through a third party website.

Reviews.Title: “Want to return”
Reviews.Author: SkywalkerNewYork
Reviews.Content: My friends moved from a much more expensive hotel to this one after visiting me. The staff were competent and friendly; my small room suited me and was well cared for. There are larger rooms as well. Breakfast was ample and delicious although I would have preferred a public breakfast room to eating alone. TV worked fine. Internet connection does not work in the room (yet) but there is some access at the front desk when necessary. Location is near popular sites but in a quiet spot which is great. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A shame!”
Reviews.Author: SwissIcebear
Reviews.Content: After the booking at Expedia and the nice photos I was absolutely convinced, that this hotel will be a big deal! Unfortunately the hotel was fully booked and we were told, that Expedia has a special deal with 170 Euro instead of the regular 215 Euro and we have to accept a room in a "special" part of the hotel. So far okay. But nightmare was just beginning! After we entered a big wooden gate, following a dark hallway we entered a dark uncleaned room. Hair and other things were on the carpet. The bath was covered with long black hair and the bed was not prepared. We informed the reception about this and were told "hotel is full, sorry". The next day, breakfast included, was also not really succesfull. The room was not cleaned and we would wait until now for the breakfast...I guess it was just a joke about this. Again the reception was not helpful and after all this hotel was a big, big shame! Don't choose this hotel and stay away from it!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: ruthiebradley
Reviews.Content: Hi there We booked this B & B via [--] and there weren't any reviews to be found but we booked it based on the photographs as it looked clean, modern and the rooms seemed to be pretty large. We were also travelling to Rome during high season and after trawling the net the best hotel deals were on average 280-300 euros per night - the Relais Palazza Taverna was much cheaper (at 180 Euro per night with breakfast included). I am delighted to say that it was a really lovely B&B and we were thrilled to have discovered it. The rooms are very clean, individual and had great a/c (v. usedful in June!!) The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - they were happy to order us taxis whenever we needed them and phoned a restaurant to confirm our reservation - they couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is just off VIa dei Coronari - which is a lovely street lined with antiques shops. The hotel is literally minutes walk from Castel Sant-Angelo Piazza Navona and the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. It was so central we were able to go visit the attractions during the day and then pop back to the hotel with enough time to change (and have a quick snooze) before dinner. A very satisfactory breakfast is served in the room every day (at exactly the time you order it!!) with everything from croissants/ toast / danishes / eggs / cereal and the usual coffee / tea / hot chocolate - it was lovely not to have to get dressed and go downstairs to a breakfast room (or as in many 2/3 star hotels to a local bar which serves the breakfast) - and unlike many 4+ star hotels there was no €25 charge for room service. The bathroom was quite small - with only a shower (when we would have loved a bath) - but it was very clean and always serviced with clean towels - so can't complain really Highly recommend this lovely B&B!! I would recommend this highly to anyone

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Palazzo Taverna
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Gabrielli 92, 00186 Rome, Italy
